comments.body:
This hacks around the macOS issue you found which is effectively the same thing as https://github.com/conda-forge/gfortran_osx-64-feedstock/issues/11

I'll post a comment there shortly about this hack (which is hopefully enough for someone to be able to find the proper solution).

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +1,5 @@#!/usr/bin/env bash

# Detecting flags from gfortran which is backed by clang fails with
#     x86_64-apple-darwin13.4.0-gfortran: error trying to exec 'cc1': execvp: No such file or directory
# This comes from
